intro: Reichantha ostaurina, commonly known as the golden starburry, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces capsules as its fruit. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Reichantha ostaurina is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
